Hitbox

Class Hitbox

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hitbox.Hitbox

  • public class Hitbox
extends java.lang.Object
    Hitbox class is used by the player and the zombies to determine if they are colliding against walls, zombies, or the player. Also used to determine if the player reaches the end point The hitbox class itself consists of 8 points, for the invisible hexagonal hitbox surrounding zombies and the player. If any of these points hit something, a collision occurs and the player/zombie stops moving.

    • Method Detail

      • getPoint

        public Point getPoint(int i)
        Returns the point from the given index.
        Parameters:
        i - one of the 8 points that surround the hitbox.
        Returns:
        the point, if it is a valid index, else, returns null.

      • updateBoundaryPoints

        public void updateBoundaryPoints(double nextZ,
                                 double nextX)
        Updates the 8 points on the collision detecting octogon based on the players location
        Parameters:
        nextZ - the next Z position on the map for the model.
        nextX - the next X position on the map for the model

      • isWallCollision

        public boolean isWallCollision(HouseBuilder house)
        Takes a look at each point on the octogon and determines what tile it's on. it then checks to see if that tile is a legal tile to be on.
        Parameters:
        house - the house
        Returns:
        true, if a point on the hitbox is colliding with a wall

      • hasReachedGoal

        public boolean hasReachedGoal(HouseBuilder house)
        Checks if any of the points has reached the end point tile
        Parameters:
        house - Our current house/map
        Returns:
        true, if a point has reached the end point

      • generateHitbox

        private void generateHitbox(javafx.scene.Group xform,
                            boolean debug)
        Generates a set of 8 points in the shape of an octogon to create a hitbox for the player. A valid move is defined as a location where none of these 8 points are on a Wall tile. Passing in the appropriate xform is only necessary for creating the graphical representation of the hitbox
        Parameters:
        xform - the xform we are giving a hitbox
        debug - debug variable for testing purposes
